tn.text: "destroyed the land" This refers to when an army will ruin the land where their enemies grow food.

tn.ref: The crown was set on David's head
tn.text: AT: "David's men placed the crown on his head" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: David required all the cities of the people
tn.text: The people are referred to by their city. AT: "David required all the peoples of the cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
These are the names of cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]
These are the names of people groups.
to control someone or something through the use of force.
a piece of wood used to stretch strings as the threads of a rug are weaved together around them.
This is the name given to a race of people who were very tall and strong. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are the names of men.

tn.ref: they were killed by the hand of David and by the hand of his soldiers
tn.text: David and his soldiers are referred to by the part of their bodies used to hold a sword. AT: "David and his soldiers killed the descendants of the Rephaim" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
